alert.note: Alert for Leake (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 7:40PM CST until December 21 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Mississippi... Yockanookany River Near Ofahoma affecting Leake County. For the Upper Pearl River...including Philadelphia, Edinburg, Carthage, Walnut Grove, Lena, Kosciusko, Ratliff`s Ferry, Ofahoma, Jackson...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Yockanookany River Near Ofahoma. * WHEN...From this evening to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding of farmland along the river is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Sunday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 13.1 feet early Friday afternoon. - Action stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Yockanookany River Ofahoma 19.0 18.8 Sun 6 pm CST 18.2 17.3 15.9 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 900 AM CST.
